hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#Set the below parameters manually package_name="rails" published_version="5.1.5"
#Check distro and available version in repo : rhel7.x, Sles11.x/12.x, Ub16.x/17.x . /etc/os-release if [ $ID == "rhel" ]; then available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "sles" ]; then available_version=$(sudo zypper info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "ubuntu" ]; then available_version=$(sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-cache policy $package_name | grep Candidate | head -1 | cut -d ' ' -f 4) fi
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo" echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi
# Install dependencies sudo zypper update -y sudo zypper install -y bison flex libopenssl-devel libyaml-devel libffi48-devel readline-devel zlib-devel gdbm-devel ncurses-devel tcl-devel tk-devel sqlite3-devel gcc make wget tar
# Download and unpack the Ruby 2.5.0 source code wget http://cache.ruby-lang.org/pub/ruby/2.5/ruby-2.5.0.tar.gz tar zxf ruby-2.5.0.tar.gz cd ruby-2.5.0
# Configure and build Ruby 2.5.0 ./configure make
# Test results and install ruby make test export PATH=/usr/local/bin:$PATH sudo -E make install
# Verify that ruby is available ruby -v gem env
# Correct the gem environment for a standard user
export GEM_HOME=/home/test/.gem/ruby export PATH=/home/test/.gem/ruby/bin:$PATH
# Install dependencies sudo zypper install -y patch make gcc
# Install Rails gem install rails -v 5.1.5
rails -v 5.1.5
